thread.title: What Do Laundry Machines and Roads Have in Common? To Investors, They’re Infrastructure

author: Ryan Dezember
title: What Do Laundry Machines and Roads Have in Common? To Investors, They’re Infrastructure
text:
Airport luggage trolleys, coin-operated laundry machines and college-town apartment buildings probably aren’t what President Donald Trump had in mind when he pledged to steer more private money into U.S. infrastructure.
But deals involving traditional public works like roads, train stations and sewage-treatment plants that Mr. Trump describes as in disrepair have been in short supply for infrastructure investors. Those projects also can lock up cash for longer than the life of most funds and can become mired in local politics.
... RELATED VIDEO What's Driving Trump's Infrastructure Plan President Trump unveiled his infrastructure initiative in mid-February as he hosted governors and mayors. The proposal aims to improve the nation's roads, bridges, airports, waterways and internet infrastructure. WSJ's Gerald F. Seib explains why powerful interest groups like the plan, despite some hurdles it faces. Photo: AP
